Question:Your school plans to require all S.6 student to attend a compulsory tutorail class at school every day. Many students are against of this. You are the form respresentative. Write a letter to the Principal, Mr. Lee, to persuade him to change the policy.

[size=4]Dear Principal,
​I am writing to express my opinion of school recent plan, which require all S.6 student to attend a tutorial class at school every day. The policy does not benefit for student. If student really want to study, they will do it themselves. There are no essential for school to force students to attend the class.
​
Compulsory tutorial means some subjects like Chinese, English and Math. These are basic knowledge of people survive in modern society. If students are not good at these subjects, they will hard to find some high pay job, such as bank, teacher. However, school want students to attend the class every day. That is unnecessary.
​
If school force students to attend tutorial class every day, students will not pay their attention on the class. Students need to go back school on Monday to Friday. They are already tired in weekend. They need to relax themselves or find their hobbies to reduce their academic stress. If school force students to attend the class every day, not only student cannot concentrate on the lesson, also they cannot reduce their stress.
​

Furthermore, S.6 pupils need to face the DSE. They are already feeling stressful. If school put more stress on S.6 student, they may do some horrible things like commit suicide. The rising number of students who cannot reduce their stress and kill themselves. Principal, you should not overlook the stress of S.6 students.
​
You may think that our students’ academic performances of compulsory tutorials are decreasing. They should be training more to avoid that.

However, the real reason is teachers.
Some teachers are not enough ability to teach our students. Their knowledge is old and now students cannot adapt that. For example, training English is no longer just reading and writing. Students more welcome to learn English through videos or games. Now teenager need interesting tutorial instead of repeating tutorial. If school do not change the ways of schooling students, the performance of students will not rise.
​
Moreover, the quality important than the number. School should spend more resource on the students who need more class. Some student may not like general student, they are stupid. They need more class to improve their ability. For example, some students study hard, but they cannot catch the skill of learning different subjects. These students need more classes to know the topics. Therefore, school should offer tutorials for them instead of need all students to attend the tutorial every day.
​
The policy is kind. However, almost S.6 students need more time to reduce their stress. School should not waste their time. If school want to help us, school should not only focus on the class, also concentrate on the quality of teachers. It is because the good students’ performance depends on teachers’ ability.
​Thank you for your kindly attention.
​​​​​​​
Your sincerely,
Form representative
Chris Wong

I am writing to express my opinion for the school's recent plan, which requires all S.6 students to attend a compulsory tutorial class in school every day. In my opinion, the policy does not necessary work for students, as students are already filled with stress with all the academic work. It will be a burden for them to spend extra time to attend the tutorial lessons.

From my understanding, the school wants students to do better in subjects like Chinese, English, and Math, as these classes are essential to a student's survival skills in the society. If a student does not do well in any of these class, he or she will have a tough time in the University if he or she is admitted. Furthermore, it will be even harder for them to find jobs in the future to build on a successful career. However, I personally don't think the policy will help them do better in these classes. Matter fact, it will put more pressure to them.

As we all know, students have to go to school on the weekdays. In the remaining time without school, they will have to worry about their homework and potentially their academic assessments. By setting up this policy, it will decrease the amount of free time a student has and increase the stress level of a student. If a student's stress level is high, he or she will do even worse on academic assessments. On the other hand, all the students will have to take the DSE in the near future; therefore, they will have to have enough time to prepare for it. Having the compulsory tutorial class will drastically decrease their preparation time.

Therefore, I have two suggestions to replace the idea of having a compulsory tutorial class. First, we shall still have a tutorial class, but we shall make it optional for students. At this age, students shall have their own judgement on whether they should seek help on the mentioned subjects. For those students, this can be helpful.
